intro: Hackelia leucantha, commonly known as white honeysuckle, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Hackelia leucantha thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to native plant gardens.
